reviews.review: This game made me harder than a brick. It all started when I queued into a game of Dead By Daylight. I brought a toolbox with a grip wrench. I loaded into the game and immediately started working on a generator. I heard the killers heart beat so I started running. Eventually the killer known as "The Spirit" caught up to me and I could see her. Immediately my penis rose higher than the empire state building and I jumped up from the erection shock. I couldn't handle myself. I immediately took off my spiderman pajamas and started touching myself furiously and passionately. Overall this game is a 9/10 because it would be better if sex was added as an intended feature.
This shit fire no cap
Very Fune

If you haven't started playing DBD, do not start now. The player base is toxic, the match making is terrible, and the updates screw the game up. In addition to all of that, I had used auric cells (in game currency that you pay for) to purchase survivors that are now locked for me. I sent a total of three help requests to BHVR with no response and this was over a month ago. So now my characters are still locked and I've been robbed of my money. This game always makes me mad... The devs don't care about what the players want and don't care to fix any of the real problems-- it's just a money grab. This game is very hard to enjoy and I personally don't recommend it to anyone who is looking to start playing.

Notes:
This game is… interesting. While it has balancing issues and can sometimes struggle to keep you entertained, the game has incredible potential. If you aren’t picky about games and enjoy a learning curve, DbD might be a good game for you to check out.
Muy buen juego

At a surface level, a fun & addictive 4v1 game. But the second you invest your time into this game it's issues start to show and oh boy are there many. Besides the plague of imbalance and toxicity that you'll encounter every game, the developers just don't care about the game anymore. Every since Netease got involved in Dead by Daylight in 2020 it's been on a downward trend. Bugs remain unfixed, security issues are ever prevalent, hackers get off scott-free and the developers are the most disconnected to the community than they've ever been. Dead by Daylight is slowly rotting away and is only here to make money. For these reasons I do not recommend Dead by Daylight currently. It's rather sad seeing the once was passion in the game put into it after so many years being stripped away in such a short amount of time.
Came from 200 Hours on Epic and still an awesome game

*sigh*

So I've played a lot of this game over the past year, and at first I was recommending it to everyone I know. Now, well...

I've got more to say, but let me describe a couple of things that I've witnessed.

- When I was still relatively new, I was playing a game as The Nurse. For the uninitiated, The Nurse is one of those killers where if you know what you're doing, you're absolutely terrifying, and if you don't, good luck even hitting someone. Furthermore, the almighty algorithm decided to pit me against 4 MAX RANK survivors, who seemed to be in one big group. During the game I got increasingly frustrated as they would continually heal each other and block my access to hooks (the goal for the killer is to hang survivors on hooks), and generally didn't even go for their objectives. But afterwards all I got from them were compliments. They told me how they respected my trying to get better at the hardest killer in the game, and even congratulated me for getting better as the match went on. I didn't realise they were giving me an opportunity to practice my Nurse gameplay, and the very next match I was doing significantly better as her. These moments have been few and far between, but let me say that the community isn't 100% toxic - the vast majority of matches I've played on either side people barely even communicate, or just give a gg.

- Just 15 minutes ago I got out of a match, where once again the algorithm pitted someone who was clearly newer to the game against myself and 4 other high level survivors. And the killer won. What followed was the killer giving a 'gg' and then a couple of my teammates verbally abusing him for the next few minutes. They accused him of camping, despite the fact that he clearly left hooked survivors to chase down other people, and said he was tunnelling us (focusing on one survivor), despite them clearly unhooking each other when he was still nearby (a bad strategy). In other words, they were mad at a new player for making completely strategic, rational decisions - they blamed him for their own bad decisions.

The thing is, DBD feels like it's partially designed in a way that inadvertently promotes toxicity. The degree of whether or not you'll do well is often in proportion to how much of a nob you want to be. As a killer, there's nothing more infuriating than survivors breaking hooks or body blocking, and there are several perks that promote and reward survivors doing this. Some killers, particularly the 3rd party ones, have mechanics which feel completely broken. And since there's no way to play casual matches(outside private games) people are more likely to take the game way too seriously, especially if they're almost at the highest rank.

But that's why I also consistently try to be respectful to other players. As a killer I often drop the last survivor off by the exit if I wipe everyone quickly. As a survivor I try to look after my teammates, and unless it's completely hopeless I do everything I can to get them out of a bad situation. I know I'm not the only person in the community to think this way. What the game really needs in the community are more players willing to put fun & encouragement over rank. 

If you do think you might like DBD, I recommend waiting for a sale or free weekend to try. The base game is pretty anaemic when it comes to content, so waiting for a sale means if you want new characters it's significantly cheaper Also, for the love of god, don't start playing on the 13th of a month; that's when rankings reset and it's way more likely you'll get matched with folks who take things way too seriously.

But if you take the 3 week correspondence course that is reading the Wiki, take some time to familiarise yourself with the game's idiosyncrasies, and just focus on having a good time regardless, there's a lot to love in this game. 


Although the devs did support NFTs, so personally I wouldn't have bought Pinhead if I'd known beforehand :/

I bought this game expecting to be able to just hop in with a few friends and have fun. Little did I know there was a ranking system where you can prestige, meta's and pay-2-win characters, and other things that I just plain didn't like. It took ~15min to find a game, the FOV felt too small, and unless you have certain perks you're apparently useless. Not saying it's a bad game, it just wasn't for me. If you're going in looking for just casual quick fun, maybe it's not for you.

I honestly hated this game. The perk system and meta in a game about being a monster or survivor really left a sour taste in my mouth. There shouldn't be a massive learning curve, essential perks, and googling viable builds. It should be blind fun akin to a game like Phasmophobia but with a player controlled scare. It also takes up an offensive amount of storage, has so many microtransactions for a paid game, and one of the most toxic communities I have seen in a long time. On top of that even if the other complaints I listed were resolved the actual gameplay loop in its self is just not satisfying. This one is a hard pass from me.

Ist Leider seid den letzen paar updates wo das Matchmaking und die Ränge neu gemacht wurden extremst frustrierend und macht kein spaß mehr. Ich hab das spiel früher geliebt und auch fast jeden tag gespielt aber z.B das neue Matchmaking ist der größte müll Ich spiel jetzt zum ersten mal seid nem Jahr und komm mit toxic red ranks in einer lobby (Als Killer und Survivor) und das 10-20 matches am stück (Das Matchmaking war früher auch nicht perfekt aber weit besser) was wie gesagt das spiel ultra kaputt macht dann dazu ist es bisschen verwirrend mit den neuen rängen weil das irgendwie einfach nur komplizierter gemacht wurde. Die Killer werden auch immer Unkreativer und nervig Fähigkeiten ähneln sich sehr stark oder der Killer ist einfach Langweilig. Zusammengefasst Anfang letztes Jahr was das spiel noch gut aber jetzt nicht mehr ich empfehl es nicht zu spielen wenn man auf sowas keine lust hat aber an sich ist das spiel recht gut.

Jogo muito bom. Porém destruído pela própria empresa! Tem vários BUGS e mesmo mandando para eles analisar, de nada resolve. Chegou um novo sistema em (TESTE) Para você poder se livrar do assassino enquanto está sendo carregado por ele. Do que adianta? Se quando você está preste a concluir (JÁ ESTA NO GANCHO). Também tem os Killers e também os jogadores trolls. Sem contar os Killers que voam, que mata a distância e na mesma hora revive todos (Os famosos HACKERS). Sim reclamamos, mais nada para melhorar! Obs: Tanto Killers quanto os próprios Sobreviventes. 
(Para quem gosta de comprar roupinhas e acessórios ou passes de temporada, infelizmente mesmo comprando pela própria Steam, você não recebe os pontinhos). E depois que deixou de graça na Epic por um tempo, muitas pessoas criaram várias contas apenas para usar "Cheat" Pois se por um acaso tomar ban, abre a conta secundária pela Epic.)
Enfim... Boa sorte! Quem sabe um dia possam balancear né?!
Mais deixo aqui meu recomendo, não custa nada gastar na conta e sofrer "um pouco"!
Deixando mais um aviso... Cuidado para quando for jogar de sobrevivente, todos quitem da partida e não te deixe lá sozinho para morrer lindamente :)

Amazing game, the sensor ques are unique to this game and make the game have more jump scares.  The 4 team aspect of the game makes it fun to play with friends.  Having the 'killer' be another player also makes the random game play unique in each game.  There is a learning curve which many may have a problem learning but it is an great game once you understand how to play.  The cat & mouse (aka mind games) game play is very fun, and for the price everyone should give this game a try.

Through introspection, the identity of this game soars past the two separate objectives of survivor and killer; surviving as a helpless soul or killing everyone that stands in your path. Not only is it a game, but it serves as an experience. An insight into people and their obsessive insight to be right and/or to "win" the game. If you do not play in per say, the survivors rules, you are open to harassment by the members of the lobby as of course, you are not "good" at the game for using "x", "y," and/or "z".  If you are a survivor however, you have no option but to follow the rules of the killer, even if they play a certain type of way against you, however unfair it may seem or be.

If you dare to touch this game, you should keep in mind that you will most likely come under attack with whatever you do in the game. If you are not perfect at this game, shows over, still getting flamed.

In conclusion, OH GOD WHY, WHY!?? WHYYYYYYY!?

Dieses Spiel ist der Grund warum wir noch nicht auf dem Mars leben können. Es ist alles Schlechte an der Menschheit verkörpert in 60gb Datenmüll. Die Dinge die dieses Spiel mit seinen Spielern macht kann mit Drogen verglichen werden, so gravierend sind die Veränderungen. Der netteste Mensch wird zu einem toxischen Sandbagger der im Afterchat Todesnachrichten raushaut. Ich schwöre, die Devs haben beim machen dieses Spiels Pandoras Box geöffnet und es ist nichts gutes rausgekommen. Ich kann nicht beschreiben welchen Hass ich auf diese Community und das extrem schlecht gebalancete MMR System und die Overpowerden Perks sind einfach die Sahne auf der Torte (Boil Over als neustes Beispiel). Ich rate jedem sich von diesem Spiel fernzuhalten

DBD's a very "fun with friends" style game. Not all that grand, and way more entertaining when you have someone to shoot the shit with, joke about, or actually strategize with. Or bitch with when you get one of Those opponents. If you're less likely to play with people you know, the fun wears extremely fast. It's silent, awkward and grating. Spinning at people's fun though.

Mechanically it's an interesting concept, but there's a lot keeping it down. The fact that there have been certain metas to winning as killer that make the game exceedingly unfun for the rest of the game and minimal ways to counter it is a strong issue that's been in play longer than I've even known of the game. It's discouraging, and while I wouldn't call fixing the lack of communication the key to fixing it, but it's certainly an unexplored (or ignored) avenue. Asymmetric gameplay's hard to really make even kind of "balanced" and I get that, but if it isn't fun it isn't fun.

DBD's a fun un-fun game, although half of the good comes from playing with friends.
